title: Very good
comment: Great job but gives wrong lat/lon values. Don't know why, and can't run the code on git hub directly, it crashes.

title: Well Done! Mobile version of RTKLIB.
comment: It is really a very good job indeed!  It provides a nice platform to integrate the satellite corrections into the mobile GPS via NTRIP.  It is great if it can correct the position of the internal gps of smartphone.  But anyway you have put a big step forward in this matter.  In Hong Kong, the SatRef satellite corrections (DGPS & RTK) are free of charge and it is definitely great if they can be applied into mobile phone.  I was surprised serval years ago when i tested the ublox low cost single frequency GPS receiver with the RTKLIB.  I really hope that same surprise can appears in my phone.  Thanks!

title: Awesome, but where's the serial connections?
comment: Seriously, this is awesome.... I've been playing with RTK-Lib for several years and I'm really excited to see this come to Android. I don't have an Android device at the moment, but I can confirm that it runs on Android-x86 project if anyone wants to check it out on their PC.  Only downside so far is that it doesn't appear to support serially connected (ie. wired) devices, which would be useful in embedded projects using U-Blox or SkyTraq (SF1315F-RAW) receivers.  Great job!!

title: Output Streams
comment: Good job! you brought the RTKLIB into more handy environment. However Output streams to TCP and file only. I am planning to test it on ARM11 development boards Tiny6410 and want to know if Output streams is possible to comm port or bluetooth?

title: Any help?
comment: Just downloaded. Can't quite figure it out how to make it work. A manual/step-by-step guide on how to use with an external GPS receiver (Bluetooth) would be great, please!
